item.title: Comment on Uploading File to AWS S3 in Golang by Akshay Khairmode
item.dc:creator: Akshay Khairmode
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/uploading-file-to-aws-s3-in-golang/comment-page-1/#comment-1856">Nihat</a>.
S3 does not have real folders but follows a key-value approach. If your need to nest it, you can use the path as <code>parentfolder/childfolder/anotherchild/test.txt</code> in the key
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Nihat.

S3 does not have real folders but follows a key-value approach. If your need to nest it, you can use the path as parentfolder/childfolder/anotherchild/test.txt in the key

item.title: Comment on Download file concurrently in Golang – Part 4(Resume) by Sugeng
item.dc:creator: Sugeng
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/download-file-concurrently-in-golang-part-4-resume/comment-page-1/#comment-4">Akshay Khairmode</a>.
Hi Akshay,
Mainly I just want to learn it, I'll try to code it myself, but it's good to have some references. Of course, I will reference this article if I publish my code :)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Akshay Khairmode.

Hi Akshay,

Mainly I just want to learn it, I’ll try to code it myself, but it’s good to have some references. Of course, I will reference this article if I publish my code üôÇ

item.title: Comment on Download file concurrently in Golang – Part 4(Resume) by Akshay Khairmode
item.dc:creator: Akshay Khairmode
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/download-file-concurrently-in-golang-part-4-resume/comment-page-1/#comment-3">Sugeng</a>.
Hi Sugeng,
Thanks for the feedback. Let me know if anything can be improved.
If your project is academic I would suggest you code it yourself so you learn better, If you are working on some production applications then please use the code at your own risk.
If it's for a personal project feel free to use it. Anyways a credit would be appreciated.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Sugeng.

Hi Sugeng,

Thanks for the feedback. Let me know if anything can be improved.

If your project is academic I would suggest you code it yourself so you learn better, If you are working on some production applications then please use the code at your own risk.

If it’s for a personal project feel free to use it. Anyways a credit would be appreciated.
